Class: NodeProvider

rtcomm. NodeProvider

Provides Services to register a user and create RtcommNodes

This programming interface lets a JavaScript client application use a Real Time Communication Node to implement WebRTC simply. When instantiated & initialized the RtcommNodeProvider connects to the defined MQTT Server and subscribes to a unique topic that is used to receive inbound communication.

See the example in NodeProvider.init()

new NodeProvider()

  • rtcomm.js, line 2143

services supported by the NodeConnection, populated in init()

Methods

createRtcommNode(nodeConfig) → {module:rtcomm.RtcommNode|RtcommNode}

createRtcommNode - Factory method that returns a RtcommNode object to be used by a UI component. The rtcommNode object provides an interface for the UI Developer to attach Video and Audio input/output. Essentially mapping a broadcast stream(a MediaStream that is intended to be sent) to a RTCPeerConnection output stream. When an inbound stream is added to a RTCPeerConnection, then the RtcommNode object also informs the RTCPeerConnection where to send that stream in the User Interface.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
nodeConfig module:rtcomm.NodeProvider~NodeConfig Configuration to initialize node with.
Source:
  • rtcomm.js, line 2386
Throws:
Error
Returns:
A RtcommNode Object
Type
module:rtcomm.RtcommNode | RtcommNode
Example
 
 var nodeConfig = { 
   audio: true, 
   video: true, 
   data: false, 
   };
 rtcommNodeProvider.createRtcommNode(nodeConfig);

init(config, onSuccess, onFailure, status)

init method This method is required to be called prior to doing anything else.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
config module:rtcomm.NodeProvider~InitOptions Configuration object for init
onSuccess function <optional>
 Callback function when init is complete successfully.
onFailure function <optional>
 Callback funtion if a failure occurs during init
status function <optional>
 Callback function to monitor status of init
Source:
  • rtcomm.js, line 2228
Example
var nodeProvider = new ibm.rtcomm.RtcommNodeProvider(); 
var nodeProviderConfig = {
  server : 'broker.mqttdashboard.com',       
  userid : 'ibmAgent1@mysurance.org',
  connectorTopicName : 'nodeConnector',   
  connectorTopicPath : '/rtcomm/', 
  port : 8000,                          
  register: true,                     
  createNode : true,                   
  credentials : null                  
};

// Initialize the Service. [Using onSuccess/onFailure callbacks]
// This initializes the MQTT layer and enables inbound Communication.
var rtcommNode = null;  
nodeProvider.init(nodeProviderConfig, 
   function(object) { //onSuccess
       console.log('init was successful, rtcommNode: ', object);
       rtcommNode = object;
   },
   function(error) { //onFailure
      console.error('init failed: ', error);
     }
);

register(onSuccess, onFailure)

Register the 'userid' used in init with the rtcomm service so it can be looked up and receive inbound requests.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
onSuccess function <optional>
 Called when lookup completes successfully with the returned message about the userid
onFailure function <optional>
 Callback executed if lookup fails, argument contains reason.

  • rtcomm.js, line 2434

InitOptions

NodeProvider Init config object
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Argument Default Description
server string MQTT Server
port string <optional>
 1883 MQTT Server Port
userid string User ID or Identity
connectorTopicName string <optional>
 nodeConnection connectorTopicName on rtcomm server
connectorTopicPath string <optional>
 /rtcomm/ MQTT Path to prefix connectorTopicName with and register under
register boolean <optional>
 false Automatically register
createNode boolean <optional>
 false Automatically create a RtcommNode

Properties:
Name Type Argument Default Description
audio boolean <optional>
 true Support audio in the PeerConnection - defaults to true
video boolean <optional>
 true Support video in the PeerConnection - defaults to true
data boolean <optional>
 true Support data in the PeerConnectio - defaults to true
context String <optional>
 'none' Context for the Handler. Used in messages and with the server. defaults to 'none'
